quotes.quote: I love anyone who breaks the rules, and musicians always break the rules in an aggressive way.
Music is the mediator between the spiritual and the sensual life.
Too many young musicians today want to win polls before they learn their instruments.
Serious musicians are finding it harder and harder to have a voice in the world of music these days.
Musicians more than most people are in the moment. That's the dual nature of that job.
As musicians, and as people who sell material for people to hear and absorb, it's important that we use that voice wisely.
If you play music with passion and love and honesty, then it will nourish your soul, heal your wounds and make your life worth living. Music is its own reward.
The wise musicians are those who play what they can master.
The great musicians are those who can reach people, who can make people feel something.
A musician must make music, an artist must paint, a poet must write, if he is to be ultimately at peace with himself.
As a musician, I hear the harmonic value of everything I just enjoy music.

Musicians have always had a better understanding of love than the rest of us. Over the years they have told us that love: is like a rock, is here to stay, is all you need, will find a way, will keep us together, will tear us apart, sucks.
Music is a higher revelation than all wisdom and philosophy. Music is the electrical soil in which the spirit lives, thinks and invents.
Musicians own music because music owns them.
The true beauty of music is that it connects people. It carries a message, and we, the musicians, are the messengers.
Music is the divine way to tell beautiful, poetic things to the heart.
The best musicians transpose consciousness into sound; painters do the same for color and shape.
I've never known a musician who regretted being one. Music itself is not going to let you down.
All musicians are potential band leaders.

Musicians from the beginning of time have been there to express the mood and the musical feelings in the air for whatever's going on in that particular culture. It's the greatest joy as a musician to be able to translate that, be part of something and watch the scenery around you.
I believe musicians have a duty, a responsibility to reach out, to share your love or pain with others.
A painter paints pictures on canvas. But musicians paint their pictures on silence.
I'm a self taught musician, so I never really had the restrictions of any one instrument. I would always just sort of pick up instruments and make noise with em.
Musicians tend to get bored playing the same thing over and over, so I think it's natural to experiment.
Musicians should not play music. Music should play musicians.
Great musicians accept everything that they hear and find something good. They take what they like and they throw away what they don't like.
Music to me is like breathing. I don't get tired of breathing, I don't get tired of music.
Musicians are always gigging and never have a chance to stop for a minute.
If some musicians put half as much effort in to the business side as they do their outer look and appearances, they could be twice as far.
Musicians don't retire; they stop when there's no more music in them.
